Content:
setting up a barterdex bob and the chips  electrum doesn't seem to work. feedback from ./setpassphrase: {"coin":"CHIPS","installed":false,"height":-1,"balance":0,"status":"active","electrum":"electrum2.cipig.net:10053"
any idea what could wring here?

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Calling balance and the sum of listspent are the same, both lower than they should be. Listspent was missing a couple 65kmd UTXOs, restarting bdex, the UTXOs reappeared via listunspent. The sum of listunspent and balance remain equal. @jl777c

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: native?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: its possible some utxo are being resrved

Author: tolken#2655
Content: yes all native

Author: tolken#2655
Content: I believe they were reserved at some point in the day.  But it was likely many hours earlier. Didn‚Äôt seem like any recent trades we‚Äôre starting.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: could i safety do something like check for pending swaps - if there are none and ‚Äúbalance‚Äù != actual balance... purge some data file and/or restart BarterDex?

Author: tolken#2655
Content: not sure what bdex data file may exist that i could safely delete, if any.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: recentswaps

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that would show the ones that are pending

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
_uses_
`    pending=$(curl -s --url "http://127.0.0.1:$port" --data "{\"userpass\":\"$userpass\",\"method\":\"recentswaps\",\"limit\":3}" | jq '.pending.timeleft') # check if awiting a swap process for any of our last 3 swaps`

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Alright, if zero pending, but old reserved UTXOs, that might be a good time to restart bdex to flush this out.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Is Pending Swaps info directly derived from the SWAPS data files?

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Or is that unique data from SWAP stages data?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: recent swaps uses DB/SWAPS and data in RAM

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, if there are missing utxo, good time to restart

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Thanks, I‚Äôll see if I can clearly detect when this discrepancy manifests and handle it.
